text:
DUBLIN- Research and Markets has announced the addition of the "Canadian Payments Forecast - 2017" report to their offering.
The Canadian payments landscape is undergoing fundamental changes as new technologies vie for the attention of consumers. Shopping habits are shifting as consumers embrace the convenience and functionality offered by smart phones, tablets and an almost ubiquitous internet connection. While mobile is mainstream in many areas, mobile payments are still embryonic. With unprecedented activity in the FinTech space, payments in Canada are likely to be transformed within the next few years.
"Canadian Payments Forecast, 2017" examines the Canadian consumer payments market in the context of developments in the Canadian economy and the fundamental shifts taking place in technology. Now in its 8th year of publication, this report will provide in-depth analysis of each of the major consumer payments segments in the Canadian market. Detailed five-year forecasts are presented on consumer payments and related acceptance infrastructure.
Payment types included in the report:
- Cash
- Cheque
- Debit card
- Credit card
- Prepaid cards
- Pre-authorized payments
- International Remittances
- Online
- Mobile
- Contactless
- Bill payments and transfers
- Gift cards
- P2P payments
- Virtual currencies
This new report provides a detailed and insightful assessment of the prospects for the Canadian consumer payments market, and is recognized by industry leaders as the most comprehensive, authoritative and independent review of the market available in Canada.
For more information about this report visit http://www.researchandmarkets.com/research/7bbfd4/canadian_payments
